results.title: Honky Tonk freeway
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Don Boyd, Howard W. Koch, AFD and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: When a new freeway is built that bypasses the tiny but thriving Florida town of Ticlaw, depriving it of the livelihood it garners from passing motorists, the mayor and other oddball citizens of the town dream up hair-brained schemes as a lure to the tourist trade. The film follows a group of equally eccentric range of travellers who inadvertently find themselves in Ticlaw—a place they never intended to visit. Cast includes Beau Bridges, Hume Cronyn, Beverly D’Angelo, William Devane, Teri Garr and Geraldine Page.

results.title: Machine gun blues = Black rose of Harlem
results.creator_credit: Fred Gallo, Mike Elliott, Roger Corman and Pacific Trust
results.brief_description: Set in Harlem in 1931 during the era of depression, bootlegging, mobsters and smokey nightclubs where white patrons came to see black jazz singers. Also a time when the mafia were trying to move in on the nightclubs and assert their control over the black Americans, a time of violence and machine guns and death to those who dared to challenge “the boss”. Georgia Freeman (Cynda Williams), a black jazz singer and Johnny Verona (Nick Cassavetes) a white mobster who works for Costanza (Joe Viterelli), “the boss”, find themselves entangled in a fiery and passionate affair which eventually can only lead to disaster, especially when Johnny is already betrothed to Costanza’s daughter. When Costanza decides to take over the nightclub where Georgia sings, all hell breaks loose. Racial tension, dangerous liaisons, lots of action and a great jazz soundtrack with a cast including Lawrence Monoson, Richard Brooks, Garrett Morris, Richard T. Jones, Tony Burton and Maria Ford. Music produced by Paul di Franco.

results.title: Swing shift
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Demme, Jerry Bick, Lantana and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Goldie Hawn and Kurt Russell star in this vivid look back at the wartime conditions that stood society on its head - and a sensitive, romantic story of the good times and the bad times a whole generation of Americans will never forget. The movie stays at home and follows the stories of men and women working in the factories that produce weaponry for the battles overseas, all produced predominantly by the round-the-clock efforts of over 3 million female workers. Many, like Hawn’s character Kay Walsh, have never held a wrench before - but you’re never too pretty to learn. Christine Lahti, co-starring as Kay’s sultry neighbour, Hazel, proves that even a dance-hall singer can handle a rivet gun. Russell plays Lucky Lockhart, the 4-F classified trumpet player who’d rather be handling real guns - until he falls in love with Kay. Kays’ husband Jack (Ed Harris) comes home on leave and finds out that his wife has betrayed him. Lucky then decides to pursue Hazel, driving a wedge between the two friends.

results.title: The In crowd
results.creator_credit: Mark Rosenthal, Keith Rubinstein, Lawrence Konner, Force Ten and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Its 1965, and rock’n’roll has ricocheted around the world. Nowhere is the music more popular than Philadelphia, where smooth-talking Perry Parker (Joe Pantoliano) hosts the city’s hottest TV show “Dance Party”. The dancing fever has also infected the suburbs where Del Green (Donovan Leitch), a high school senior, spends most of his time spinning, twisting and daydreaming of Vicky (Jennifer Runyon), “Dance Party’s” reigning teen goddess. On a dare Del foregoes his college entrance exam, auditions for the show, is chosen and becomes an instant success. Del and Vicky become “Dance Party’s” hottest new couple. To the beat of 60s rock’n’roll, and against a steamy backdrop of fancy footwork and raw competition, their make-believe romance becomes a doomed off-stage love affair.

results.title: Illegally yours
results.creator_credit: Peter Bogdanovich, Crescent Moon, De Laurentiis Entertainment Group, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This is the off-beat story of Richard Dice (Rob Lowe), a college dropout who comes back home only to find himself on jury duty in the trial of his high school-sweetheart, Molly (Colleen Camp), who is charged with murder. Convinced she’s been framed, he sets out to prove her innocence - only things don’t go according to plan when he finds himself the target of a band of crazy thugs; shady conspirators; millionaires; jurors; judges and the police. But really, what’s a little perjury, blackmail, burglary and murder among friends.

results.title: Rage
results.creator_credit: George C. Scott, Fred Weintraub and Getty and Fromkess Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in the peaceful farming landscape of Wyoming, and made at the height of the Vietnam War, “Rage” reflects the anger and suspicion that existed in the minds of many Americans towards their government and the military, particularly in regard to weapons testing and experimental research with chemical warfare. Dan Logan (George C.Scott) is a single father who lives with his son Chris (Nicolas Beauvy) on their sheep ranch in Wyoming. Life can be hard but the close bond between father and son is strong and the environment, although remote, is peaceful. But not for long. Whilst out on a camping trip, Dan’s world is shattered. The Logan ranch has been accidentally sprayed with a lethal dose of experimental nerve gas by an Army helicopter - Chris is in a coma, the sheep are dead, or dying, and Dan himself is dying. Seeking medical attention Dan finds instead that he is to be used as a guinea pig by the Army doctor, Major Holliford (Martin Sheen) to see what effects the nerve gas has on humans. Bitter, angry and frustrated by what appears to be a cover-up, and the eventual death of his son, Dan seeks revenge in the bloodiest and most brutal way possible. This is George C. Scott’s second directorial role (“The Anderson trial” (1970) television film being his first). The film includes a great support cast with Richard Basehart and Barnard Hughes. An appropriate film for the times.

results.title: Morgan Stewart's coming home
results.creator_credit: Alan Smithee, Stephen J. Friedman and Kings Road Entertainment
results.brief_description: For the first time since he was a young boy, teenager Morgan Stewart (Jon Cryer) is invited by his parents to make the move from boarding school to home. Packing up his dorm room, Morgan sets out with high hopes that are swiftly quashed as it becomes apparent that his parents invited him home as a political move, eager to impress voters with the “family” push. When he meets the down to earth and wrong side of the tracks girl, Emily (Viveka Davis), Morgan is forced to choose between pursuing his own interests and maintaining the awkward sense of family. In the process Morgan discovers corruption by his father’s campaign press secretary (Paul Gleason) which also challenges his sense of familial loyalty. Cast also includes Nicholas Pryor and Lynn Redgrave.

results.title: Jinxed
results.creator_credit: Don Siegel, Herb Jaffe, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A farcical comedy involving professional gambler Harold (Rip Torn) and cabaret singer Bonita (Bette Midler) who spend their time moving from state to state in pursuit of Willie (Ken Wahl), a jinxed croupier who earns them a number of small fortunes. When Bonita and Harold meet and fall in love, the stakes change and a plot to murder Harold ensues. The plot unravels when Harold accidently dies. One is left wondering whether it is Bonita who is really jinxed?

results.title: Continental divide
results.creator_credit: Michael Apted, Bob Larson, Amblin Entertainment and Universal Studios
results.brief_description: A romantic comedy starring John Belushi as a Chicago reporter who becomes a Mafia target following his series of articles exposing corruption. Hoping to alleviate the situation, his editor sends him on an assignment to a remote location in the Rocky Mountains to write a feature story on a reclusive researcher (Blair Brown) studying the endangered American bald eagle. Initially reluctant, she lets Belushi stay and despite radical differences their mutual attraction gradually draws them together. Cast also includes: Allen Goorwitz, Carlyn Glynn, Tony Ganios, Val Avery and Bill Henderson. Music composed and conducted by Michael Small. Editing, Dennis Virkler. Cinematography, John Bailey. Script, Lawrence Kasdan.

results.title: I Was a male war bride
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Sol Siegel and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Classic Howard Hawks’ comedy sees Cary Grant play Captain Henri Rochard, a French officer who falls for an American army official staioned in Europe. Following the chaos however, and bureaucratic red-tape that marked the cessations of hostilities in World War 2, the pair find it almost impossible to make their union legal. Circumstances force Rochard to pose an a ‘war bride’ in order to secure happiness, which of course leads to no end of strife and embarrassment for the eager groom.
